content: It's possible that Alexander's actions to help Aphrodite gain more power on Olympus could lead to him being viewed as an enemy by the demigods at Camp Half-Blood and Camp Jupiter. These camps are dedicated to the training and protection of demigods, and their ultimate goal is to defend the Olympian gods and the mortal world from monsters and other threats. If Alexander is seen as working against this goal by aligning himself with Aphrodite's ambition to gain more power, it is likely that the leaders and members of the camps would consider him an enemy. However, it is worth noting that Alexander is also a demigod, and that the members of the camps may show some understanding for his actions if they are rooted in wanting to protect his mother and family.
